markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Types of Terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=1521)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 210 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Each of the nine fundamental geomantic terrains represents a wide variety of environments and biomes. For instance, the mountain terrain applies to hilly regions, the forest terrain applies to jungles and rain forests, and the swamp terrain includes marshes and bogs. While each of these fundamental terrains isn't homogeneous and offers diverse magical secrets to a geomancer, over time, geomancers have nonetheless developed certain broad associations with each type. 
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<document level="2" id="rules-1522" />

text: Types of Terrain Source Secrets of Magic pg. 210 1.1 Each of the nine fundamental geomantic terrains represents a wide variety of environments and biomes. For instance, the mountain terrain applies to hilly regions, the forest terrain applies to jungles and rain forests, and the swamp terrain includes marshes and bogs. While each of these fundamental terrains isn't homogeneous and offers diverse magical secrets to a geomancer, over time, geomancers have nonetheless developed certain broad associations with each type.
